Description: Update docs to reflect configuration-based approach.

Description: Update code to use configuration instead of hardcoded values.

Summary: Search codebase for hardcoded model names
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Find all hardcoded model references.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track ingestion performance and add metrics.

Summary: Ensure ingestion doesn't depend on LLM provider
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Verify ingestion pipeline is provider-agnostic.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Search codebase for hardcoded model names and replace with configuration-based references.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Ensure embeddings are functioning properly with current setup.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Automatic retry with exponential backoff. Fallback to alternative provider on failure. Graceful degradation.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Anthropic-specific errors (rate limits, API errors). OpenAI-specific errors. Better error messages for users.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Cost tracking per provider. Performance comparison (latency, token usage). Error rate comparison.

Summary: Add LLM provider/model tracking to query logs
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Add llm_provider field to QueryLog model. Add model_name field to QueryLog model. Update log_query_async() to accept provider/model parameters. Pass provider/model from query endpoint to logger.

Summary: Update cache keys to include LLM provider
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Location: backend/src/api/routes/query.py (lines 204-207). Include provider in cache key: f"{llm_provider}:{question}". Prevents cross-provider cache hits (GPT-4o response returned for Claude query).

Summary: Create Vena API analytics and monitoring
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track API call frequency and costs. Monitor API response times. Track data freshness metrics. Alert on API errors or failures. Dashboard for Vena API health.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Webhook support for Vena data changes (if available). Polling mechanism for data updates. Event-driven cache invalidation. Real-time sync status dashboard. Notification system for sync failures.

Summary: Enhance error handling and retry logic
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Exponential backoff for rate limits. Retry strategies for transient failures. Circuit breaker pattern for API failures. Graceful degradation when API unavailable. Detailed error logging and alerting.

Summary: Create data transformation and formatting service
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Transform Vena API responses to RAG-friendly format. Format hierarchies for prompt injection. Structure dimension members for context. Aggregate intersection data for summaries. Handle large datasets with summarization.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Store model IDs per tenant/user. Model ID discovery and validation. Support for multiple models per tenant. Model metadata storage (name, description, last sync). Admin UI for model ID management.

Summary: Implement intelligent caching for Vena API data
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Cache dimensions, members, and hierarchies. Cache intersection data with TTL based on data type. Cache invalidation strategies (time-based, event-based). Multi-level caching (memory + Redis). Cache warming for frequently accessed data.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Background job to periodically pull Vena tenant data. Incremental updates (only changed data). Full sync capability for initial setup. Conflict resolution for concurrent updates. Sync status tracking and reporting.

Summary: Enhance Vena API client with additional endpoints
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Implement model listing/discovery (if available). Add support for dimension hierarchies endpoint. Add support for member relationships (parent/child). Implement pagination for large datasets. Add rate limiting and request throttling.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track which documents are most frequently retrieved. Identify unused or outdated documents. Document quality metrics.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Search documents by name, content, metadata. Filter by status, category, date range. Bulk operations (approve/reject multiple).

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Store document source, author, last modified date. Track document approval status and workflow. Store document categories/tags.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track document versions in database. Support document updates without full re-ingestion. Incremental ingestion (only changed documents).

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Iterative improvement process. Version control for prompt experiments. Rollback capability.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track prompt performance metrics. Compare versions side-by-side. Identify prompt weaknesses.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Test suite for prompt variations. Automated evaluation metrics (accuracy, relevance, hallucination rate). A/B testing infrastructure.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Break down monolithic prompts into smaller, reusable modules. Create prompt component library (anti-hallucination rules, VenaQL syntax rules, source citation guidelines, etc.). Support component versioning and composition. Create component registry with metadata (purpose, usage, dependencies). Enable mix-and-match prompt building from components. Support component inheritance and overrides. Add component testing and validation.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Support Jinja2-style templating for prompts. Allow dynamic sections based on query analysis. Support prompt composition (base + specialized sections).

Summary: Add context injection to RAG pipeline
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Inject user role/tenant-specific instructions. Inject query type-specific guidelines (VenaQL vs general questions). Inject recent conversation context.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Support variable injection (user context, tenant info, query metadata). Support conditional prompt sections based on query type. Support few-shot example injection based on query similarity.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Track prompt execution time, token usage per prompt version, error rates per prompt version.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Add prompt metadata to Sentry scope before LLM calls. Include prompt in error context when LLM errors occur.

Summary: Add custom Sentry tags for prompts
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Add tags: prompt_version, prompt_type (system/user), llm_provider, model_name.

Summary: Add Sentry breadcrumbs for prompt execution
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Log prompt version used, prompt template (truncated if too long), context documents count and sources, LLM provider and model used, token counts (input/output).

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Environment variable: PROMPT_VERSION (defaults to "latest"). Support per-tenant prompt versions (future).

Summary: Create admin API endpoints for prompt management
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: GET /api/admin/prompts - List all prompt versions. POST /api/admin/prompts - Create new prompt version. PUT /api/admin/prompts/{version}/activate - Activate a version. GET /api/admin/prompts/{version} - Get specific version.

Summary: Add prompt version tracking to query logs
Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Log which prompt version was used for each query. Enable analytics on prompt performance.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Create backend/src/services/prompt_manager.py with CRUD operations for prompts, version comparison and diff functionality, and A/B testing support (run multiple versions simultaneously).

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: Store prompt versions with metadata (version number, date, author, description). Track which version is active/production. Support rollback to previous versions.

Description: Build comprehensive monitoring and analytics dashboards for prompts, performance, and costs.

Creator: Miles Waite
Description: This epic covers all GDPR compliance requirements for the FCS RAG Bot system, as outlined in the GDPR Compliance Business Requirements Document. The requirements are organized into three phases: Phase 1 (Critical), Phase 2 (High Priority), and Phase 3 (Medium Priority). Reference: GDPR/GDPR_COMPLIANCE_BUSINESS_REQUIREMENTS.md

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-001
*Priority:* Highest
*Phase:* Phase 1
*GDPR Articles:* 15, 17, 20

Users must be able to exercise their fundamental GDPR rights: access to their data, deletion of their data, and export of their data in a portable format. Right of Access (Article 15), Right of Erasure (Article 17), Right to Data Portability (Article 20).

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Summary: REQ-002: Automated Data Retention and Deletion
Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-002
*Priority:* Highest
*Phase:* Phase 1
*GDPR Articles:* 5(1)(e)

The Privacy Policy commits to specific data retention periods: query logs for 90 days, user accounts for active period plus 30 days, and cached data for 24 hours. Implement automated deletion scripts.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-003
*Priority:* Highest
*Phase:* Phase 1
*GDPR Articles:* 7

The Privacy Policy states that users acknowledge reading and understanding the policy by using the service. However, there is no mechanism to track or record this consent.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Summary: REQ-004: Third-Party Data Processing Agreement Verification
Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-004
*Priority:* Highest
*Phase:* Phase 1
*GDPR Articles:* 28

The Privacy Policy states that all third-party processors are bound by data processing agreements. However, these agreements have not been verified.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Summary: REQ-005: Right to Restriction of Processing
Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-005
*Priority:* High
*Phase:* Phase 2
*GDPR Articles:* 18

Users have the right to request restriction of processing in certain circumstances. Implement restriction mechanism with user table field and processing logic.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-006
*Priority:* High
*Phase:* Phase 2
*GDPR Articles:* 21

Users have the right to object to processing based on legitimate interests. For query logging, users may object if logging is not essential.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-007
*Priority:* High
*Phase:* Phase 2
*GDPR Articles:* 33, 34

GDPR requires notification of data breaches to supervisory authorities within 72 hours and to affected users if high risk. Create breach detection and notification procedures.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-008
*Priority:* High
*Phase:* Phase 2
*GDPR Articles:* 32

The Privacy Policy lists security measures including encryption, access controls, and monitoring. These measures must be verified and documented.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-009
*Priority:* Medium
*Phase:* Phase 3
*GDPR Articles:* 30

GDPR requires organisations to maintain a record of processing activities documenting all personal data processing. Create comprehensive ROPA document.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-010
*Priority:* Medium
*Phase:* Phase 3
*GDPR Articles:* 5(1)(c)

GDPR requires data minimisation: only collect and process data that is necessary. Review current data collection and implement minimisation where possible.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-011
*Priority:* Medium
*Phase:* Phase 3
*GDPR Articles:* 30, 32

Audit logs are required to track data access, modifications, and security events. These logs must be retained for 7 years for compliance purposes.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._

Creator: Miles Waite
Description:
*Requirement ID:* REQ-012
*Priority:* Medium
*Phase:* Phase 3
*GDPR Articles:* 35

A DPIA is required for high-risk processing activities. The system processes personal data using AI/ML technologies, which may constitute high-risk processing.

---
_This story is part of the GDPR Compliance Implementation epic._
